Description: Head of female terracotta figure wearing her hair in 'melon style' tied back in a bun, following Tanagra types. Mould-made and solid. Coated in a white lime wash, possibly with traces of red on the hair at the back of the head. Fine brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Fine example following Tanagra types. Fabric could be local. Parallels from Naukratis in the British Museum (GR1886, 0401.1418), Bristol Museum (H840) and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA542, NA547). Copy of Greek 'Tangaras' (Bailey 2008, 141, see also 3524, GR 1926,0930.12), with close Egyptian parallels purchased at Memphis (Petrie et al. 1910, pl. 44: 155 and 161, Petrie Museum UC48475), in Tübingen (Fischer 1994, no. 94) dating from the end of the 4th to 3rd century BC. Similar hair treatment in Egyptian figurines is dated from early to the third quarter of 3rd century BC by Török (1995, nos. 214, 215). See Ptolemaic parallels (Dunand 1990, nos. 704-6). Mid to late 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, no. 197). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Petrie, W. M. F. MacKay, E and Wainwright, G. 1910. Memphis, vol III: Meydum and Memphis. London. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma. Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.367) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
